title: Web3 Internship Bootcamp · Learner
description:
Participated in a 4-week Web3 internship program jointly initiated by ETHPanda and LXDAO.
Focused on hands-on learning through task-driven practice, covering Web3 fundamentals, tooling, and real-world workflows.
Completed guided study and practical tasks along technical and operational tracks, producing verifiable learning outcomes.

title: Organizing Team · Technical Support (Night Shift)
description:
Provided night-shift technical support during a high-intensity AI hackathon.
Assisted participants with development environment setup, tooling configuration, and common debugging issues.
Coordinated with the organizing team to resolve technical blockers and ensure smooth event operations during off-peak hours.

title: Master of Engineering, Electrical and Computer Engineering
description:
GPA 9.22/10.
Graduate training in electrical and computer engineering.
Coursework covering systems, computer networks, digital communications, applied machine learning, data science, and advanced software testing.

title: Service Router Test Platform Dev Student (Intern)
description:
Worked with Ethernet and Optical teams to validate hardware and embedded software in a Linux-based regression environment.
Developed and executed 3 optical test cases and conducted 1,078 regression tests on QSFP28 4x25G/100G PSM4 transceivers.
Reported 7 critical embedded software bugs and verified 8 fixes across multiple software images.
Improved GASH scripts and CI/CD-driven testing workflows.

title: Bachelor of Engineering, Electrical Engineering and Automation
description:
GPA 87.2/100.
Undergraduate training with a strong foundation in electrical engineering, control systems, power electronics, power systems, and automation.
Supported by extensive laboratory work and engineering projects.
